column4: can someone tell me where the default desktop backgrounds are stored?
dpkg -L packagename will show you the files in that package.
no, it's not in the alternatives method
sometimes programs require JAVA_HOME to be set
it should point to the root of your actual java installation.
which java did you install? Like, I have java-6-sun installed, and the root of that installation is in /usr/lib/jvm/java-6-sun/jre
Yes, I think that should work: "export JAVA_HOME=/usr/lib/jvm/java-6-sun/jre"
but that depends on how well the script is written. Sometimes that JAVA_HOME has to be set to the JAVA_ROOT/bin subdirectory, so you might have to test it
what program are you running? As sudo maybe ?
setting the variable as user, then running script sudo will not work
are you running the script as sudo?
it's just that you have to set the JAVA_HOME the right way
are you running the script (whatever it is) as sudo??
ok. And as user you do "export JAVA_HOME=/path/to/jre" and then ./scripttorun?
but suit yourself, if you think it might help...
